intro: Alysicarpus monilifer, commonly known as the chainfruit plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its leguminous structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant produces unique fruiting bodies that resemble chains, hence its common name. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it typically grows as an herbaceous perennial. Alysicarpus monilifer is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forests.
